results.title: Mickey's Christmas carol (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Burny Mattinson
results.brief_description: Mickey’s Christmas Carol features Scrooge McDuck as the miserly Ebenezer Scrooge, Goofy as a rather accident-prone ghost of Jacob Marley; Jiminy Cricket as the ghost of Christmas Past, and a host of other Disney favourites! It’s all the magic of Disney animation in an enchanting new version of the world’s best-loved Christmas fantasy. Rated: G

results.title: Mickey
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Rare film footage of Walt Disney introduces the long and charming life of the greatest cartoon character of them all - Mickey Mouse. Mickey started life as Mortimer, but the name just didn’t seem to fit! Instead, he became Mickey Mouse for his show business premiere on November 18, 1928. Mickey’s screen debut was in the first animated cartoon to feature synchronised sound: “Steamboat Willie”. In addition to Mickey’s first film role, this collection also includes some of his greatest adventures highlighted in a career that has spanned over 55 years. Titles include “Steamboat Willie”, “Mickey’s grand opera” and “Symphony hour”, all classics in their own right.

results.title: Mick: revisited
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Tom Manefield and David Roberts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Second part of a longitudinal study of Mick, an adolescent from Sydney’s western suburbs. Looks at the effects that the first film, made two years earlier, had on him and explores his attitudes towards his ethnic background. (See the first part “Mick” (Title code 012708).

results.title: Mick Doohan
results.creator_credit: Dorna, Paco Latorre and Sergi Sendra
results.brief_description: This extensive profile of motorcycle racing world champion Mick Doohan charts the major milestones of his remarkable career from 1992-1996. Footage of his most memorable races is backgrounded by an extensive personal interview. His family, mechanics, friends and race rivals also give insights into his personal life and career.

results.title: Mick and the moon
results.brief_description: A biography of Mick Numierie Jabaljari, an Aboriginal painter. Deals with the beliefs of the Central Australian Aboriginals concerning the moon, sun and the wind. Commentary by David Gulpilil and Tony Barry.
results.description: A biography of Mick Numierie Jabaljari, an Aboriginal painter. Deals with the beliefs of the Central Australian Aboriginals concerning the moon, sun and the wind. Commentary by David Gulpilil and Tony Barry.

results.title: Mick's gift
results.creator_credit: Flying Carpet Films, Steve Thomas and Celeste Geer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Family foibles”.
Part of the “Family foibles” series of five documentaries about Australian families. Filmmaker Celeste Geer takes as her starting point a box of long forgotten 16mm amateur film shot by her late grandfather Mick in the 1940s and 1950s, in an attempt to better understand the character of the man she idolised as a child. She found that the memories captured in the footage of his family, friends and travels and the those that emerged through the recollections of family members and an old mate, offered up contradictory images of her grandfather which challenged the mythology around him built up in her family history. A film that questions the way family memories get tailored for the consumption of future generations. A study guide is available from http://www.roninfilms.com.au/related/2365104851-0.pdf

results.title: Mick
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Tom Manefield and Phil Noyce
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
Mick, the adolescent son of migrant parents, has been in trouble with the law since he was in Year 8 at school. He did not succeed at school. He cannot find a job and believes he is better off on the dole than working in a factory. He is hooked on tattoos and his ambition is to be tattooed all over. Explores the problems of being young in Mt. Druitt (New South Wales). NB: A sequal to this film was made two years later - “Mick revisited” (Title code 012754).

results.title: Michigan, USA
results.brief_description: Michigan in the heart of America surrounded by the Great Lakes offers entertainment, relaxation, scenic beauty and history to the visitor. Detroit city, the ultimate in modern civilization and industrialisation; nostalgic Mackinac Island where motor vehicles are prohibited; historic Greenfield Village with its blacksmith; water sports on the numerous lakes, and exciting winter sports are but a few of the attractions.
